Reviews.Title: “the bed”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The bed is very hard and uncomfortable change for the better I hope, everything is excellent, but this epithet. Sometimes go to a primer inn hotel said that because of the bed comfortable and internet for free!

Reviews.Title: “Week's Stay at IBIS AL RIGGA”
Reviews.Author: Wzafar Z
Reviews.Content: The hotel is write in the middle of "food street" as i like to call it. Very nice place to stay but no attraction other than restaurants nearby. The METRO is in walking distance which is very convinient to get anywhere. Taxis are easy to get as the hotel is on the main road. It's a newly built property opened less than 3 years ago, therefore in good condition. Good value for money (if booked in adavnce). Food is very expensive at the hotel and i think they should re-do their prices as many options are nearby. no WI-FI in the room and internet is usually sold seperate and very very expensive. Also if you buy x number of hours, they will expire after x number of hours whether used or not. For e.g. if you buy 3 hours, it will expire after 3 hours from first log-in even if you used it only for 20 minutes. This is a "cheap" way to make some money.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: alanst
Reviews.Content: Ive stayed at many Ibis Hotels in many parts of the world and this one offered the same basic, clean and functional accomodation as they all do, however I was very dissapointed in the service and attitude of front desk staff when calling the hotel and checking in. Also, arriving late the hotel lobby and bar was full of working "ladies". I was dissapointed that the hotel allows this especially as Ibis are usually seen as family hotels. I would beware if you go with family to this hotel, it wasnt very pleasant at all. If I go to Dubai again I would look elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “Typical IBIS: Best Value vs. Money”
Reviews.Author: Hossam_Elgeneidy
Reviews.Content: - Very nice location - Excellent Price - Huge value for the money you will paying I would highly recommend it for travelers going to Dubai on a low budget

Reviews.Title: “Excellant and value for money. Budget Comfortable hotel Tp Relax”
Reviews.Author: Vijaymenon
Reviews.Content: Excellant hotel. As IBIS is famous for, standards are mainainted. I got a very good rate even though it was DSF time. AED 250 is worth for it .

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for a stop-over on a budget”
Reviews.Author: gillesat Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ibis Al Rigga on our way back from Asia the night of January 10th, 2011. The place was a very clean hotel to stay in. The room was exactly what you expect from an Ibis hotel category. There was no coffee / tea in room but this is not the kind of category where you get such services anyway. So this was great value for money overall. Breakfast is quite complete. Being used to all kinds of Accor hotels from Sofitel to Mercure, and now Ibis, I have to say we did not expect a lot of a buffet breakfast but even so we were surprised by its wide range of choice. We spent all day running around the city (with the hop-on hop-off bus, both its day and its night guided tours are very nice). The hotel is conveniently situated in the center and the metro station is at about 2 mins walking distance from it. The metro can even take you to the airport very easily without your having to change lines. This would definitely be our choice again if we had to stop over in Dubai. Gilles M.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Vazil
Reviews.Content: The Ibis is a clean, modern hotel located just off the main area in Deira, however the area is great on its own. Within easy walking distance of hotels, bars and the metro station. Rooms are clean and perfect for a few nights stay. The only issue is the confusion at the front desk when checking in. The staff was nice but needs some training.

Reviews.Title: “Great value on a budget”
Reviews.Author: compassNSEW
Reviews.Content: If you want fancy - this isn't it! If you want clean, comfortable, safe, and inexpensive - this is the place for you. A taxi is $15 USD from the airport. A metro station is about 1 1/2 blocks away. The Dubai Creek is a 20 or 30 minute walk. The rooms are very basic with comfortable beds, A/C, nice private bath, warm showers, and adequate storage, and electrical outlets. Sleep well and save some money to use towards an evening meal time splurge.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stopover hotel”
Reviews.Author: Telecoms_BizDev
Reviews.Content: It was a clean, functional hotel. The room was typical of Ibis properties - compact, efficient and clean. Everything needful was at hand. Staff handled check in and check out without a hassle, everything was exactly as booked. The location was within a couple hundred meters of a Metro station, which gives access to nearly every significant location in Dubai, including the airport. Surrounding neighborhood wasn't glitzy but was certainly nice enough. Only downside was the breakfast buffet. Food was disappointing -- inedible in a couple of instances -- and the coffee was weak. But the bar was fine, even had a two-for-one drinks special during happy hour. I'll definitely stay there again, but will probably skip breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: asif644
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 days. Check in was a bit irritating as they could not find my booking.The hotel is situated in Al Rigga Road Diera, outside the hotel the whole street is full of restaurants. The metro station is 5 mins walk away. The airport is not far by taxi (10-15 mins) or by metro. The hotel is new and the rooms are spotless. Good bed and decor, the rooms have TV and wardrobe but lack other amenities. The bathroom is tiny but clean and functional with a shower. Breakfast was OK with a fair choice. Breakfast time was hectic and at times finding seating was difficult. There is additional seating outside. There is also a internet cafe in the reception area which is free and they have 3 computers available. There is free wifi in the lobby area but if you want wifi in your room you have to pay for it.. I liked this hotel as it offers good value, is very clean, in a good location and i would stay there again. Only other area for improvement would be the reception staff who seem to be overwhelmed.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant but without many frills.”
Reviews.Author: greetani
Reviews.Content: This place is cheaper if you book online. Hotel location is very close to Metro station and is surrounded by many eateries and malls. Rooms are small and basic but pleasant, washrooms are small as well. Room service is good but the reception can be more friendly. The hotel also has a small fitness center. The restaurant looked good but we did not eat there as there are many options around. The Bar looked good but closes by 11 PM. Overall, a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay and smile”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Actually you never expect that such alrigga hotel with the front office staff and manager and shift leader are that cooperative with all your demand. the location is wonderful where you find lots of shops and restaurants and also easy accessable transportation. safe place, nice place and wonderful memories

Reviews.Title: “Great location, affordable, clean. enjoyed the stay”
Reviews.Author: SKF976
Reviews.Content: few steps away from metro, nothing to complain about cleanliness, staff nor facilities. A very good option for future stay.

Reviews.Title: “To : Ibis Al Riga Hotel - Dubai”
Reviews.Author: TheChampionegypt
Reviews.Content: Att : Mr. General Manager From :General Mohamed Habib. Champion Tours Egypt Dear Sir Have a good day from Champion Tours - Egypt First of all , please let me size my deep appreciation about my pleasant stay At IBIS Al Rigga Hotel in Dubai, as I stayed at Room no 733 From 03 - 11 Jan. 2011 , And the stay was real nice , without any negative comments, as you have an excellent staff At all the Hotel departments ( House keeping - room service - food & Beverages - Front Area ...) Therefore I would like to start a positive co-operation by using The hotel for our Egyptian Clients

Reviews.Title: “At the heart of Dubai!”
Reviews.Author: mehdi C
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Ibis Al Rigga for 3 nights & enjoyed a lot. Hotel location is at the heart of city & you have access to nearby metro station & lots of taxi's.you can find lot's of nice restaurants & cafes in Al Rigga (Mcdonald,KFC,Burger King, Starbucks,Nando's & more other ones. It is also closed to shopping centers like Al-Ghurair & Deira city center. The staff were nice but some of them did not take care of customers. The negative point is not to have a refrigerator in room. The hotel was clean and well serviced & you can rest at night without any loud voices of clubs. It is also a good atmosphere for families. The breakfast was so nice too.

Reviews.Title: “Dubai on a Budget”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a reasonably priced hotel in Dubai, with essential room facilities and somewhere to eat/drink 'in-house' 24/7, look no further than the Ibis Al Riggar. It's not far from the airport, very close to a metro station and has lots of local shops and businesses nearby. It's ideal for the cost-conscious visitor to Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Management terrible.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I had a disagreement on arrival about my booking. Management were not helpful. I had a disturbed nights sleep due to howling winds and had to change rooms. Despite this taking 40 mins to acomplish and three telephone calls to reeption, I was further told that this did not qualify for their free staay if satisfaction not given in 15 minutes policy. Breakfast looked poor, I did not have this myself due to the booking error.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly in the old city centre”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very good location, Al Rigga metro station is in 3 minutes walking distance. it is absolutely in the city centre (but this is the old city, not the fancy and shiny Jumeira) The room is clean, but the bathroom could be a bit bigger. The only thing I did not like is that they provide only 2 towels for 2 persons (so no handtowel). Just for comparison reason: the taxi from terminal 3 costed 32 dirham.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad - could do better in restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Tufty&Co
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Ibis Al Rigga for five nights recently with my partner. The free underground car park is excellent but the reception staff were cold and not as welcoming as other hotels I've experienced in Dubai. The Al Rigga area is convenient for the Deira and Dubai Creek areas and Al Rigga Road itself has many restaurants including an excellent Indian right across the road! The room was small-ish but beautifully clean as was the rest of the hotel which looks as though it was originally intended to be offices/apartments? The bar was small with satellite TV and served expensive drinks in a not-very-friendly environment. The barman provided 'free' popcorn and was cheerful. The free wi-fi in reception was acceptably fast - but it didn't work in the outside seating area. The restaurant for breakfast was chaotic with cheap furniture (a chair broke when I tried to move it, exposing sharp nails) and the food - although theoretically plentiful - wasn't refreshed and replenished as often as necessary. The main breakfast also finished at 10.00am which is early if you're on holiday and staff made it very clear that it was 'finished' by closing a curtain bang on the dot of the advertised time! The a la carte food in the lounge area was over-priced and not well cooked either. We didn't eat there often, but when we did, the main courses (pizza and chicken cordon bleu) was over-cooked to the point of being inedible. As we were in a rush, we did eat it though. The ordered fresh fruit salads comprised chopped apples and small pieces of melon with half a strawberry on top. Very poor and we refused to eat/pay for these. The serving staff then became stroppy and we were cold-shouldered subsequently. Overall, the hotel was good - but try and eat out whenever you can. A more friendly, welcoming reception team and some attention to the details mentioned about would transform this property.

Reviews.Title: “Great Option but still misses a few things”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I regularly stay with IBIS whenever I travel and I am quite happy with the chain. My main complaint is that the rooms do not carry a coffee/tea maker option. The location, cleanliness, parking, WiFi facility etc is everything that a business traveler like me count on when I choose a hotel but I am a bit dissappointed with the lack of coffee/tea facilities in the rooms. Many other hotel chains in the same class offer this. My only request is to offer this and you will have a life customer.

Reviews.Title: “Drilling noise”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is decent. For some reason they are constantly under construction and the loud noise of drilling is often heard in the rooms in the morning. We stayed here at this hotel several times throughout. The last year and this problem has been persistent. That being said the staff is friendly, the rooms are decent.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good position, not far from the airport and in the centre of the old city area. The room and bathroom were clean and in general the room met our expectations. The main drawbacks were the lack of an electric jug and bar refrigerator. The other problem that seems to be common to many Ibis Hotels is the very hard bed. We did appreciate having a nice restaurant and availability of alcohol. We booked our room well in advance and got a much cheaper rate than that advertised on the day. Overall we thought we got reasonable value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Short visits to Dubai”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I used to stay in IBIS Al Rigga in all my visits to Dubai. I get the best rate when by online booking few days in advance. The hotel is providing best quality services compared to all other hotels in the area in all terms. All what I miss is a little fridge in the room which may add another star to the hotel classification but without any increase in the room rate. The Hotel is very close to all services and to Merto station. Very good choice.

Reviews.Title: “My stay in IBIS”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I did not find my stay in this hotel not very pleasant! Room size was ok. But no proper wardrobe in the room. No kettle for preparing Tea/Cofee provided. Bathroom was really terrible. No place to keep any change of clothes. No proper soap or shampoo provided. No room service. Desk service also very poor. Overall I will never again stay in another IBIS hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Just one night”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Al Rigga for one night this time. I have stayed there before and you did get Value for money, but my recent stay there i was not impressed. Aircondition in the room took 9 hours constant running on 5 degrees (which works only when you have your keycard in the slot luckly we had two) to cool the room down from 25 degrees to 21.5 degrees and after that it wouldnt get any further down. Sleep was ok after the roomwas cooler. In the Morning when taking a shower the water was cold. This is my first time i had a problem with this hotel and hope it was just a one off. I have been there several times. On another note I find the price of 100 AED a bit steep for 24 Hours Internet also been told by staff that i have to stay logged in the whole time otherwise i would be charged but would not be able to log in again. Other hotel do have internet compimentary in the rooms. I will seriously think about taking another Hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “There are better Ibis choices in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: MichaelPohl
Reviews.Content: The Al Rigga Ibis is a AED 35 taxi ride fm the airport. One of the two recently added Ibis hotel in Dubai. Appeared to me that a substantial number of the guests there are single Russian n African ladies. The rest are genuine Russian tourists. I salute the Front Desk ladies for their forbearance. Breakfast was mediocre. The bar was more like a boarding gate than a bar and the bar counter was designed by someone who obviously never sits on a bar stool. Next time i go back to the Ibis Mall of the Emirates - much better value for money

Reviews.Title: “Yes, this is an OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ericguy19
Reviews.Content: Usually, my wife and I choose Ibis hotels: they are predictable; convenient; a known product. This was no exception. It is a 10-15 AED ride from the airport, and 30 AED from the Dubai Mall. 300 metres from the nearest Metro station. However, we had no room safe, no bar fridge, no hand towels and no coffee making facilities. Given that we spent minimal time at the hotel, this was OK.

Reviews.Title: “Very good solution for transit in Dubai.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We had pleasure to stay again at Ibis Al Rigga hotel on the way from our beach vacation in Fujairah. Good location close to airport, easy to get from hotel to many places of interest such as city center, Dubay Mall, Emirates Mall, Gold Souk, Mamzar Beach Park etk. Price also was very attractive. Good solution for 1-2 days transit in or out of Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very good location, good reception and friendly staff but improve on room facilities like pressing stone for straightening you're casual wears, complementary bottled water for the first night, refridgerator, electric kettle, safety storage box, like other IBIS Hotels around the world especially the one in UK.

Reviews.Title: “OK for one night.”
Reviews.Author: SR666
Reviews.Content: The hotel provides acceptable accommodation and is conveniently located now the metro is working. The room was small and provided the basics except there was no electric jug or tea/coffee making facilities. Internet is an extra charge. Breakfast was included for the price and was just OK.

Reviews.Title: “Clean good position but lo w service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: we have been there for 5 nights and it is very clean and the position is very good, really 2 minutes by walk to the metro but there is no mini bar in the room and also no room service, not even a bottle of water or boiler in the room, i think this basic things should be there!!! The staff was most of the time confused and not prepared!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: An ideal hotel if you have work in Deira and Bur Dubai Area. The Gym located on the 6th floor is a plus for those people who like to stay fit. The only disadvantage is that the towels are really worn out and need to be replaced.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Enchanting City View”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hey guys ! This is nice opportunity to express our stay with IBIS rigga. i opt everytime i wish to spend my weekends as this is near to the metro station, and all other hot spots places inthe city. RIGGA St is most happening st i have expereinced in Dubai Festivals and Others Festives.. Rooms were good but can be more moderate and spaciious. but still it worths your rent. nice city overview. Thanks you! Afsar khan

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for what we needed”
Reviews.Author: 123Vicky
Reviews.Content: Can't really fault this hotel, we were expecting a real cheap basic place and got more than we were expecting! The room catered for our needs, good size, working aircon, bathroom, tv etc.. Breakfast was better than we were expecting, we never left the hotel hungry in the morning. The gym was perfectly adequate and the staff were very friendly. Hotel is right next to the metro line which is very convenient and cheap. Would thoroughly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Strongly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very good service, neat and clean, co-operative staff. It is very good for business travellers. The hotel is also located on the main Regga street where one has large choice of restaurants at walking distance. Also close to shopping mall and Metro station

Reviews.Title: “Poor Experience”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I was not at all happy with the Room Size. Too compact and no moving space. No water in the room, no Tea making machine. Overall I would like to forget the experience. The location is the only advantage of this Hotel, but rest is a gib let down. Something has to be done for this.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean place for a good price”
Reviews.Author: DarjaandNathan
Reviews.Content: The rooms were in good condition and very clean - it seemed new or newly renovated. The service was generally fine, certainly no problems. We liked that it is pretty close to the Al Rigga metro station, which is an easy way to get from the airport and around the city. The only thing I would change would be to have free internet in the rooms - you could go to the lobby, which was pleasant, but not convenient.

Reviews.Title: “easy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: It was very easy for me to find the hotel and parck my car in the asement. Also I was able to have a fast check-in. The rooms are clean and have advanced facility, I may say that rooms are still a bit small compared with other rooms in Dubai. But the price was very cheap for This area.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel at walking distance from Metro Station”
Reviews.Author: SPPatelIndia
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful, easy located near to Metro Station in Dubai. The rooms are neat, comfortable, small and cozy. Its definately smaller room size, but very comfortable. Things I like about this hitel: 1. Location 2. Its has ample of good restaurants in its vicinity.. for indian food.. Akbar Restaurants is bang opposit, Bombay Dining is just 200 metes away 3. Breakfast - Since, we had to leave early in morning we did get an early morning breakfast, first time ever I have come across a hotel which provides early morning or late breakfast. 4. taxis available easily The only hitch was the last nite we stayed in hotel, the fire alarm went on.. it was a false alarm. I wish the rooms had a small refirgerator, the hotel has an ice machine on 6th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel reminds me of a wild west saloon... Unsafe... Fire !”
Reviews.Author: NightWhispers
Reviews.Content: This is one of the strangest hotels I have ever been in. It is huge, spotless, and in a great location. The rooms are clean. That's about all I can say that's good about it. What's a building without service ? Moreso, what's a hotel where at one point your personal safety is put into doubt because a fire alarm went off and no one was there to tell you what to do ? I'll get to that in just a moment... Let me describe my experience from day one. I booked this hotel from the accor hotels website, it had the lowest rate, 161 dirhams per night, as well as a stay 3 pay 2 nights promotion. I thought, what the heck. OK, first glitch, you can't get this promotion unless you pay in advance with your credit card... OK.. Did that, and got the confirmation... Arrived there early morning. No one to help with my stuff (ok, I'll give them that, 161 dirhams, 2 star hotel, can't expect much I suppose)... Entered and gave the receptionist the reservations reference. "oh, sure, we have the reservation, but I need to charge your credit card....." "but I already paid when I did the booking ?" "nope" .... OK, this went on for about 5 minutes until I just gave up and gave her the card. She took an authorisation... Fair enough. Went up to my room, at a 36C humid temperature, the AC was stuck at 25. Tried to call someone... No answer at reception... Tried again, no answer at reception. Got to work all afternoon in the heat, tried in the early evening, no answer.... This hotel has a placard in the rooms that is proudly displayed at the entrance... "if for any reason we can't solve your problem within 15 minutes, you'll be our guest..." the caveat for this is, you actually need to find someone who'll listen to you, which is hard enough when you have 2 receptionists tending 208 rooms. Don't get me wrong, they're polite enough for the most part, but the logistics of this hotel are seriously overwhelmed... I went to sleep that night, with the hot AC. Went down the next day, asked to speak to the manager, the receptionist was checking people in nodded and said ok, please wait a moment.. I did... Guess what happened... The receptionist turned out to be the "in charge for the day" which according to my understanding meant that she was the one ultimately responsible for the running of this hotel... OK, I played along and asked her to tend to last night's problem, she denied that happened and tried to convince me I may have dialed the wrong number (!) OK. The issue will be resolved by the time you return this afternoon. To their credit, it was, and my room was cold. Later that night I needed a longer network cable. OK, this time I managed to reach reception, who sent someone up who (literally) did not know what a network cable is. An hour later, I get a call back from the woman who tells me (no network cables, sorry). The next day I tried to take a shower, the mixer was stuck at "hot"... Another attempt to reach reception failed. I was just too frustrated at this point to bother anymore. I went down and asked to confirm my bill and the receptionist tried to confuse me with some talk about the numbers being wrong and asked for my reservation. I sent it to her and she told me again the numbers were wrong and that the calculation was different. At this point I was fed up and went up to sleep at what was thankfully supposed to be my last night there.Through the banging and yelling in the hall outside, I fell asleep at midnight . At 2:45 am the FIRE alarm went off.... "we are investigating a potential fire, please stand by..." or something like that the automated announcement went... for a full half hour (at least). I stood in the hallway with the other guests, all of us obviously too confused since no one at the hotel came up to tell us what to do .... and do you think anyone managed to get through to reception ? nope... What happened at the end of the half hour ? the announcement simply stopped... No notice, nothing, just like that... Of course that meant I had no more sleep for the rest of the night, when I went down in the morning, I asked what had happened. Guess what, there WAS a small fire on the third floor of the hotel... No one told us anything. I tried to follow up about the promotion and was given the runaround, I tried to speak to the manager and got some guy who was on duty, basically to tell me "nothing he would do". I told him I was an unsatisfied customer, at the treatment, mentioned the problems I had encountered, and he just shrugged it off like it was the most normal thing in the world. This hotel gets two stars. The staff, I hope Ibis decides to retrain. As for the manager that decided to tell me off because I told him I didn't want to hear the "form reply" that "they're going to take it into consideration and under advisement". I've been in customer service for a long time. Let me assure you that in every company I have been in, customer safety comes first, then their satisfaction. It's a key to return business. If Ibis does decide to reply to this review, please avoid the form reply of "taking suggestions into consideration".

Reviews.Title: “Average compare to other Ibis Hotel i'd ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: unlike other ibis hotel in my home country, no service during check in, you have to carry your own bags. the check in process is quick. the location is superb, near to mall, food and public transport. one bad impression, a guy at the front office - without name badge that I met in the afternoon at 23 April 2011, in my opinion, does not assist me properly with the information about the shuttle to deira city center. I realize that the shuttle is not provided by the hotel, however he should assist me nicely by asking me to wait and asked security, who is at the front of the hotel, to call me when the shuttle came, instead of asking me to go out and wait at the front - for about 25 mins, 20 mins behind the schedule of the shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Probably the nicest Ibis hotel, I've ever stayed at. New, nice, clean, about 200 meters from the Metro, lots of taxis in Al Rigga Road, shops, restaurants and another mall close by. Only minor complaint: Very hard mattresses.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfying hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gwaladar
Reviews.Content: In late February 2011 my mother and I stayed a couple of nights in this hotel and our overall experience was very positive. We stopped in Dubai just for curiosity while returning to Europe from Singapore and this hotel was (and is) really a very pleasant and comfortable option. Fortunately we didn't have any problem at all. The staff was very nice and they attended us correctly and professionally. Our room was very clean, very tidy and cleaned every day. In fact the whole hotel was very clean, so it seems that the cleaning staff does an excellent job. Also the personnel at the reception was correct and helpful. Our twin room was spacious, modern and very well equipped -it obviously had air-conditioning, while windows could not be opened. The room price we paid didn't include breakfast but we happily paid the extra cost of the breakfast because it was superb. In other words: I'm the kind of person who loves to start the day with a good and powerful breakfast and I can confirm that this hotel provides this and more (I would have exploded if I had eaten everything the breakfast buffet offered). In line with the hotel's restaurant, let me explain as well that one evening we had dinner at the hotel and the food quality and quantity were also very good. Finally let's say something about the location. In the first place, it is relatively close to the airport (if there are no traffic jams, a taxi will take you there in only 15 minutes) which can be also reached by metro (the new Al Rigga metro station is just a 5-7 minutes walk from the hotel). The area is also safe (in fact it seems that Dubai is, in general, a very safe place) and there are quite a lot of restaurants in the same street, where it is possible to have good and reasonable meals. My conclusion is that if I ever visit Dubai again and this hotel maintains its service level and price, then this will be my sleeping option.

Reviews.Title: “Good Ibis”
Reviews.Author: Waterfall84
Reviews.Content: Brand new Ibis. Rooms bigger and cozier than most Ibis I have been in. Very close to the new metro and convenient to airport. Minus: Wi-Fi not free in rooms (which is typical in Dubai on the other hand), only in lobby, small reception (very busy) for such a big hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, good location, very bad service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This is a new Ibis hotel. My room was nice and clean and everything was working fine. The location is close to the city center (Deira) and there are lots of restaurants nearby. Nonetheless the room was very quiet. The room rate is very reasonable for Dubai hotels. The service attitude of the staff, however, is dismal. I had a lot of baggage but the watchman/doorman did not point out that there were trolleys available to take the baggage to my room. When you want to call the hotel they do not answer the phone when the lone receptionist is busy. I had requested a wake-up call; it was acted on with a delay of 45 minutes. The "Early Riser" breakfast promoted in the guest directory was not ready at the time advertised. I had the impression that the staff would just love for all the guests to fade away... A case of good hardware but very poor software - the result is a disaster.

Reviews.Title: “NICE BUSINESS HOTEL TO STAY IN”
Reviews.Author: anilsapra
Reviews.Content: Close to Airport, Located on main road so connectivity to other part of the city is easy, Rooms are small but very neat and clean , Coffe shop with free Internet keeps you always conected. I am a frequent traveller and i have stayed 3 times in this hotel in the past 4 months and we have standerized for our company. Not expensive a scompare to other closeby noisy hotels in the around. Bar is good , one can spend evening nicely and not expensive. Breakfast quality is good and fresh .

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: BuckeyeStu
Reviews.Content: We stayed here three nights and were very satisfied. Very clean hotel and a very convenient location near the metro. We did have a problem with noisy construction next door while we were there but the staff was very helpful in finding us a new, much quieter room (with a better view!).

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: Ral1977
Reviews.Content: Very good value at this hotel. + location + cleanliness + free internet and computer in lobby (4 computers) + the room (large for ibis) + gym room + luggage room - we let the luggage for 12 hours, no problem for them. - the window can not be open - not so nice breakfast; u can eat very good nearby with less money. Time for check in: 10 min; time for check out: 5 min, check out without any problems after 12 am. Overall - very good stay there.

Reviews.Title: “personnel not motivated. ac locked”
Reviews.Author: jeff41
Reviews.Content: rooms are clean, hotel well located, good breakfast. personnel is really not motivated. waited for 40 minutes to check in with all kinds of people snicking in to the front desk talking to receptionists about everything and receptionists not worrying about people waiting in line - if there was a line! at one point I asked : is this a reception or just a desk and the reception is somewhere else! ac in the room was locked at 10 °C and it took a while to understand that it was broken. called and the guy came to fix it but it took a while to get the temperature back to the human level.in the meanwhile one hour of sleep was gone. i think the hotel needs a better management.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy, but no free WiFi”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Affordable hotel with comfortable and clean rooms without any fuss. Liked the closeness to Dubai's metro. Only four stations away from the airport. However, is there really a need to charge for WiFi in rooms? This should be free!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: HerseyeSahip
Reviews.Content: Ibis Al Rigga is nice hotel .It is too close to metro and around hotel there are kfc , burger king , traditional food restaurants markets briefly it is so central place. Free internet in lobby , free parking . Fitness center was in 6th floor but i didnt use it so i dont know whether it is charged or not,

Reviews.Title: “clean, but bad service”
Reviews.Author: kave_m
Reviews.Content: This Ibis hotel in the Dubai al Rigga and good location for the ones that want to be in deira good point: clean, the room, bath, lobby, bed are really clean, clean very clean , the hotel is new and that cause hotel in good situation. hotel have beautiful lobby that is more for ibis two star Restaurant have very beautiful table out door bad point : very bad service ,reception do not respect your query and needs at the first day of stay when we want to have rest afternoon we hear a loud noise like construction that we could not sleep well then we ask to change room but reception respect enough and they change our room next day i ask reception to solve my room phone problem several time but again they do not respect enough do not try to call the hotel because they do not answer the phone I think the problem is not the person in reception I think hotel need more reception to handle the guest queries. very little restaurant for breakfast, most dishes in breakfast be empty and refill very slowy Breakfast is not Ibis Standard one I recommend not use the breakfast free internet only in lobby not in the room like other ibis standard

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for the Cost”
Reviews.Author: redanteater
Reviews.Content: The Ibis Hotel Al Rigga is a great value - the price is quite reasonable (under US $100) per night. Rooms are small and sparse (only amenities in the bathroom are liquid soap on the sink and shower); there's not much in the room other than the bed, a desk, television, and phone. As the hotel is relatively new, it is clean, and it's not bad for a few nights stay. The location is about a block from the Metro station, and is relatively easy to get to. There's also a number of ethnic restaurants walking distance from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Unhelpful reception staff,basic amenities”
Reviews.Author: saltoAlta
Reviews.Content: BAD THINGS: Did not offer the bag storage, even though we had many bags-we had to struggle our self with these to upper level . They have bag storage on ground floor is anyone should want this: ASK them -because they do not offer-we saw this service after we are already with our bags on level 7( the lifts are very small for baggage). We make 3 trips for this. Electricity in room did not work well, had to try many times to get it. Expensive internet. - use net cafe nearby, MUCH cheaper.( but if you have own laptop with you I think its free wifi in lobby) Reception doesn't like to help to call a taxi. says doesn't have the contract with taxi company. If you are ladies , you can expect many approaches from men outside on the street asking your mobile number, or if you want dinner. Be careful about this. We were a little bit scared about it. Ignore these people. Apparently it's because of the location. GOOD THINGS Well has a great Lebanese restaurant nearby - really excellent value.Easy subway station in the day. Very nice and delicious breakfast. Nice soap in the bathroom. Very polite and helpful OUTSIDE security person.

Reviews.Title: “President”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: No enough towel / some noisy during midningt / no available free internet in room

Reviews.Title: “Excellently located brand new hotel”
Reviews.Author: sheddie70
Reviews.Content: Excellent location if arriving late or departing early from dubai international airport. hotel is located in deira, 3 stops from the airport on the new dubai metro (station Al Rigga). Approx 200 m walk from metro station. Also easy acces by metro to bur dubai and sheik zayed road, and by foot to souks and creek. Lots of restaurants/cafes etc in the neighbourhood and short walk from large shopping center. Hotel is brand new and so in excellent condition and very clean. Excellnet choice of international tv channels. Wifi available but expensive

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly staff - good location - Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: RishiSB
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 6 (Aged 25 to 60), stayed at this hotel from Dec 27th to Jan 2nd , 2011. Pros: Central location in Diera , close to the train station, city center mall, in the midst of whole range of restaurants. Cons: The reception was very unfriendly. They took 30mins (literally) to do the check in. The receptionist was taking other calls, helping her colleagues, running around here and there while I was waiting for her to complete the process, which actually took just 5 mins. This is the way they treat ppl landing from international travel! The first impression was annoying! The reception never had any proper info about the near by locations, tours etc.,.They dont even help in getting a cab. They point to the security guard, who was not helpful either. No free internet in the room, but there are computers in the lobby where the visitors can access the net for free. No one told us about this, until the last day, I figured out by myself. At 250 Dhirams per room, there were bed bugs in the room! Not even a bottle of water when u enter. We had to run around finding coins for the wending machine, to buy water! The double bed room just had space to walk. The booking said 2 single beds but they gave all double beds! The vending machine in the floor got stuck. But the repair man was kind enough to get to my room and give back the coins :). The room key (card) was so light that i managed to break it easily. They charged 20 dhirams for a new one and said their system was under repair and so cant give me a new card until next morning. I had to take someone from the reception each time to let me into the room! Sick ! Overall not worth the money! Bad service.

HotelInfo.Name: Ibis Al Rigga
HotelInfo.Address: Al Rigga Road, Deira | PO Box 186878, Dubai, United Arab Emirates
